required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of an Alumina Free Device Surface on BMD in Patients Implanted With an SL-PLUS™ Femoral Stem for THA
clinical_study.official_title: A Market Surveillance Study Assessing the Effect of an Alumina Free Device Surface on Bone Mineral Density in Patients Implanted With an SL-PLUS™ Femoral Stem for Total Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Alumina particles from the grit blasting of Ti-alloy stems for hip arthroplasty are suspected to contribute to aseptic loosening. An alumina-reduced stem surface was hypothesized to improve osseointegration and show comparable short-term outcomes to those of a standard stem.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomised controlles trial, double-blind. Block randomization with block size 10.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Bone mineral density by DEXA
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 7 days (baseline) after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density around the stem is measured as a surrogate for prosthesis in-growth by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry device (DEXA) (General Electric).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Bone mineral density by DEXA at 3 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 3 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density around the stem is measured as a surrogate for prosthesis in-growth by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry device (DEXA) (General Electric).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Bone mineral density by DEXA at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 6 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density around the stem is measured as a surrogate for prosthesis in-growth by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry device (DEXA) (General Electric).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Bone mineral density by DEXA at 12 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 12 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density around the stem is measured as a surrogate for prosthesis in-growth by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry device (DEXA) (General Electric).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Bone mineral density by DEXA at 24 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 24 months postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Bone mineral density around the stem is measured as a surrogate for prosthesis in-growth by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry device (DEXA) (General Electric).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of radiolucent lines on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 12 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for radiolucent lines (RLs) around the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of radiolucent lines on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 24 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for radiolucent lines (RLs) around the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of osteolysis on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 12 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for osteolysis around the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of osteolysis on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 24 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for osteolysis around the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hypertrophies and atrophies on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 12 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for hypertrophies and atrophies around the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of hypertrophies and atrophies on hip radiographs (AP and axial) at 24 months.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed at 24 months postoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of radiographs for hypertrophies and atrophies around the stem.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 1 month preoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 12 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 24 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 1 month preoperatively.
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Harris Hip Score (HHS) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 12 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Harris Hip Score (HHS) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed 24 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: For clinical scoring, the Harris Hip Score (HHS) will be assessed.
THA survival rates and adverse events will be documented up to 24 months postoperatively.

arm_group.description: Rectangular SL straight stems made of titanium alloy (Ti-6Al-7Nb). The control stem (STD-SL-PLUS stem) underwent alumina grit blasting to reach the adequate roughness of 4-6 micron.

Rectangular SL straight stems made of titanium alloy (Ti-6Al-7Nb). The experimental stem (NT SL-PLUS) underwent alumina grit blasting to reach the adequate roughness of 4-6 micron. The surface of the NT SL-PLUS stem was thereafter additionally treated chemically by short-acid etching with HF and mechanically by dry ice blasting in order to loosen and remove the residual alumina particles up to 96% without changing the existing surface microtopography.

intervention.description: Patients undergoing primary total hip arthroplasty are randomly assigned (1:1) to receive either an uncemented NT-SL-PLUS Stem (Smith&Nephew Orthopaedics AG, Aarau, Switzerland) or a matching uncemented STD-SL-PLUS stem (Smith&Nephew Orthopaedics AG, Aarau, Switzerland) in a blinded fashion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 years and older undergoing primary THA for primary or secondary osteoarthritis will be enrolled.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria were ongoing therapy with cortisone or medications influencing bone metabolism.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Prof. Dr. med. Niklaus F. Friederich
